parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the cooling system can cause the engine to overheat, leading to damage to the engine, cylinder head, and other components, which can result in costly repairs, engine failure, and even engine seizure.
symptoms: The temperature gauge rises to the red zone
the coolant level drops
the vehicle overheats
the radiator fan fails to turn on
the fan belt breaks or cracks
the water pump leaks or fails to circulate coolant.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Trailer Chassis Stress Cracks and Hitch Failure
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The development of stress cracks in the trailer chassis can lead to a loss of structural integrity, causing the tongue to separate from the trailer, which can result in accidents, injuries, or fatalities. The inadequate hitch design can also lead to trailer detachment, further increasing the risk of accidents.
symptoms: Stress cracks appear on both sides of the tongue
the tongue begins to separate from the trailer
the hitch is unable to support the intended weight capacity.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The misalignment of the front entrance door can cause the door to sag, making it difficult to open and close, and potentially leading to water intrusion, noise, and reduced structural integrity.
symptoms: The front entrance door sags
the door is difficult to open and close
the door does not align properly with the frame
the door has a gap between the door and the frame
water enters the vehicle through the door.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the power steering system can cause the vehicle to be difficult to steer, increasing the risk of accidents, especially when hitting bumps or navigating tight turns.
symptoms: The vehicle is difficult to steer
the vehicle wanders or drifts while driving
the vehicle bounces out of lane when hitting bumps
the power steering pump makes noise
the power steering fluid is leaking.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the power steering system can cause the vehicle to become difficult to steer, leading to increased risk of accidents, especially at low speeds.
symptoms: The power steering suddenly locks up
the steering wheel becomes stiff or hard to turn
the vehicle pulls to one side while driving
unusual noises or grinding sounds come from the power steering system.
